page.title: 02Arts and Crafts in The Lee
page.content: In this area of natural beauty, artists capture landscapes & old buildings on canvas to be enjoyed for many years. {Metalwork}As a hobby, a resident makes weather vanes}depicting animals & country scenes which often can be seen on roofs & chimneys in the surrounding area.{Basketmaking}is prolific in the village & many kinds of lovely baskets are made to order & 1 or 2 residents can recane seats to extend useful life of old furniture. Hedglaying is carried out by the Woodland Conservation Trust & the skills involved in this dying craft can still be seen.{Woodcarving}using local types of wood produces beautiful work. {Clock-repairing}is done by a resident who restores old clocks & sells them locally & all over the world.
